content.title: Biju Yuva Sashaktikaran Yojana
content.department: Department of Higher Education, Govt. of Odisha
content.details: Launched in the year 2013-14, 'Biju Yuva Sashaktikaran Yojana' is a scheme by the Department of Higher Education, Govt. of Odisha. In this scheme, ₹ 30,000/- per student is transferred directly to the bank accounts of 15,000 meritorious +2 students through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) for the purchase of laptop. The allocation earmarked to SC & ST students in a particular stream is bifurcated between SC and ST as per the ratio 16.25:22.5, which is also the reservation ratio in employment in the State. The scheme is applicable to students from the CHSE Board, and Upshastri Students passing from Shree Jagannath Sanskrit University, Puri.
benefits: An amount of ₹ 30,000/- per student is transferred directly to the bank accounts of 15,000 meritorious +2 students through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) for the purchase of laptop.
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident/domicile of the state of Odisha.
The application should be a +2 Passout from the Council of Higher Secondary Education, Odisha.
The students clearing the Upshastri Exam from Shree Jagannath Sanskrit University, Puri are also eligible.
documents_required: Passbook of Bank Account with Account Number and IFSC Code of the Bank Branch
Admit Card / Hall Ticket of CHSE Exam or Sanskrit Exam.

faqs.question: Which Department Manages The 'Biju Yuva Sashaktikaran Yojana' Scheme?
faqs.answer: The 'Biju Yuva Sashaktikaran Yojana' Scheme is managed by the Higher Education Department, Government of Odisha.

faqs.question: When Was The 'Biju Yuva Sashaktikaran Yojana' Scheme Launched?
faqs.answer: The 'Biju Yuva Sashaktikaran Yojana' Scheme was launched in the year 2013-14.

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Amount Of Financial Assistance Available Through This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The Maximum Amount Of Financial Assistance Available Through This Scheme is ₹ 30,000/-.

faqs.question: What Is The Purpose Of The Financial Assistance?
faqs.answer: The amount deposited in the bank account student should be used for the purchase of the laptop.

faqs.question: How Many Scholarships Are Awarded Every Year?
In What Ratio Shall The Allocation Earmarked To SC & ST Students Be Done?
faqs.answer: The allocation earmarked to SC & ST students in a particular stream is bifurcated between SC and ST as per the ratio 16.25:22.5, which is also the reservation ratio in employment in the State.

faqs.question: Is This Scheme Only Open For The Students From CHSE?
faqs.answer: The scheme is applicable to students from the CHSE, and Upshastri Students passing from Shree Jagannath Sanskrit University, Puri.

faqs.question: Is The Amount Of Financial Assistance Provided As A Lump Sum Or In Installments?
faqs.answer: The amount of financial assistance provided as a lump sum.

faqs.question: How Is The Amount Of Financial Assistance Transferred To The Bank Account Of The Student?
faqs.answer: The amount of financial assistance transferred to the bank account of the student through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

faqs.question: Can Students From The State Of Karnataka Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme is open only to the students who are a resident/domicile of the state of Odisha.

faqs.question: Which University Conducts The Upshastri Exam?
faqs.answer: The Upshastri Exam is conducted by the Shree Jagannath Sanskrit University, Puri.
